content.description:
A short route but more fun than you'd think, get on this line while the corners are still sharp!

The first 30 feet are characterized by the perfect #2 Camalot.  The final 10 feet pinch down to as tiny as you want, with face holds out right to finish and clip.  Too bad it wasn't longer.
content.protection: To really sew it up, 3x #2s, 1x #1, and 1x #0.5.  You could go down to a Blue Alien, but the face holds offer reprieve.
content.location: You can see this route from Horsefly, probably another 50 yards past the Horsefly/Remediation alcove.  Look for the crack shaped like a needle.

climbs.name: Unknown PH fingers to hands splitter

content.description: Lie back the start on the lighter rock where a block has come off the wall and pull into the off fingers splitter that passes a hollow flake and turns to thin hands as it winds it way up the wall before thinning down again before the anchors. Cripy edges abound on this thing but are hard to trust. There's a nice hold to clip the chains from to take the edge off after climbing through some thin stuff.
content.protection: Cams from tips to hands (.3 to 2 Camalots) with extras in the off fingers to thin hands.
content.location: Right of Crescent Corner and Petrified Hornet (where the trail comes up) by maybe 50 yards. Look for the splitter cutting the dark face with a block missing at the start of the climb from the left side of the crack, leaving a white scar.

content.description: Finger crack in left-facing corner with a couple of roofs to ascend. The crack starts with off fingers and moves to tips at the top. There's some scumming and mantles to be had on this thing to make it a little more than your typical layback and/or jam in a corner crack.
content.protection: Several small cams from tips to off finger size (.3 to .75 Camalots).
content.location: Walk to the far left of the Petrified Hornet Wall, perhaps 100 yards or more left of Crescent Corner, Petrified Hornet, etc. (where the trail comes up). Look for a finger crack in a left-facing corner with an anchor easily visible from below. You have to scramble up some ledges to reach the base. Just to the right, on the same ledge system, is The Buzz, a 50 foot 5.11.

climbs.name: Sting
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner Jr., Peter Arbic, Michelle Garbert, Tess

content.description: This splitter crack is as good as they get. It is 30 feet left of Crescent Corner, which is excellent, and goes through a roof on fingers, then rattly fingers, thin hands, some jugs, and hands through an overhang. If you get a hot day, this little wall is worthy for this and the two routes to the right of it.
content.protection: 1 x .5 friend3 x #1 friends5 x 1.5 friends4 x #2 friends4 x #3 friends

content.description: Petrified Hornet is a good right facing corner up steep rock to an interesting top out.

Jam up a lower-angle section using your best corner crack skills until you reach a good rest below a mini-roof/bulge. Place a piece high and gun it to a less-restful rest.  Manage the pump on the steep section with good small feet.  Make one last move up to the left to clip the chains.
content.protection: .3-.5 Camalots with emphasis on .4.  Orange TCUs fit nicely above the mini-roof.
content.location: Climber's right of Kiefer Ari.  Start up a chossy band taking extra care when pulling onto a shelf that has a few loose rocks.  Walk about 10 feet straight ahead to the obvious corner crack.

content.description: one of the most splitter routs in the creek. my long winded ass can't say enough!

The offwidth for climbers with only small racks! Start in a slot with fingers in the back. Scum your way up to the first of two bomb bay chimneys. More shimneying gets you to the top of a pillar before entering the second bomb bay. Enter the slightly widening chimney before finally hitting the roof. Use the finger crack to pull out the roof and stand on a small ledge to clip the chains.
content.protection: 2x0.3s, 4x0.4s, 4x0.5s, 2x0.75s. Maybe a 1. I also placed a 5, but it could easily be replaced with a smaller piece. The last chimney section could also be protected with a 6 or VG, but where's the fun in that? Two bolts with chains for the top.
content.location: 100 meters to the right of Petrified Hornet. Also to the right of "unknown PH fingers to Hands splitter" by 20 meters. The established trail puts you directly below this slot.

content.description:
After a tenuous slabby start (which warrants the 10- rating), follow a fund corner/chimney with "infinite options" for jams, laybacks, mantles, and whatever other trickery gets you up at around 5.9. Watch for some loose rock, though we tried to get most of it.

A second and third pitch could be added, but the crack changes nature (wide!) and has some potential rope cutting choss deep inside.
content.protection: #1 to #5, with a #6 optional but not necessary.
content.location: Just to the right of the "Unknown PH Fingers" route.

content.description: This is the obvious, right-facing corner between Sting and Petrified Hornet.  There appears to be a second pitch...

Want to try a tighter version of 4x4? A nearly identical in geometry roof, except in #3s, follows a bouldery start.  Now enjoy (or suffer) the remaining 30 feet of baggy #4s to the chains.  Kind of off-widthy at the top.
content.protection: A #0.75 or #1 for the start, #3s for the roof, and a few #4s for the remainder.
content.location: 30 feet to the right of Stumpy Hornet, on top of a Chinle tier involving a single 4th class move.
